summary: Build a website for JK Tution Center with a public site plus student and admin dashboards, including student self-service profile creation and an admin-managed student profiles panel, and add admin-managed site settings (logo + contact details) with removal of Caffeine branding.
architectural_notes: Student Profile entity fields: name, age, class, school, batch (1 or 2), tuition center, parent mobile number, date of birth, profile photo are required; student mobile number is optional.
Permissions: students can create their own profile and view it read-only; admins cannot create profiles but can edit existing student profiles.
Admin Dashboard includes a dedicated 'Students' panel listing all student profiles (regardless of who created them).

Admin-managed website logo must be uploaded via Admin Dashboard and stored in the backend canister as bytes so it updates instantly without redeployment; public site and student dashboard should read the latest logo from the backend.
Admin can edit all contact details (e.g., phone, email, address, WhatsApp, hours) via Admin Dashboard; updates should propagate to public site and student dashboard.
Remove all Caffeine branding from the UI.
known_issues: Existing direction to use only frontend static image assets conflicts with the new requirement to store the logo in the backend canister for instant updates.

existing_features.title: Create a public-facing JK Tuition Center website with a landing page that clearly presents the tuition center name, an overview section, course/program highlights, contact details, and a prominent sign-in button.
Implement authentication using Internet Identity and establish role-based access control with at least two roles: Admin and Student (User).

Build a Student (User) Dashboard that displays the signed-in user profile summary and provides read-only access to tuition center information managed by admins (e.g., announcements and available courses).
Build an Admin Dashboard that allows Admins to create, update, and delete site content that appears on the public site and Student Dashboard (at minimum: announcements and courses).

Provide initial admin bootstrap: allow the canister to be initialized with at least one Admin principal (configurable), and include an admin-only UI section to view the current user role and (optionally) list known users/roles for troubleshooting.
Apply a coherent, modern visual theme for an education/tuition brand (colors, typography, spacing, components) and use it consistently across landing page, Student Dashboard, and Admin Dashboard.
Add generated static image assets for branding and use them in the UI via frontend static files (do not serve images from the backend).

Replace the current name-only ProfileSetupModal-based flow with a student profile creation form that collects all required student profile fields (and optional student mobile number) and allows uploading/selecting a profile photo; ensure the form is shown only when the signed-in student has not created a profile yet.

Add a new "Students" section in the Admin Dashboard that lists all student profiles and allows the admin to open an edit view/modal to update an existing student profile (but does not provide any UI for creating new student profiles).
Extend the React Query layer to support the new student profile APIs (create-by-student, admin list all, admin edit) and ensure relevant queries invalidate/refetch after mutations.

Add an Admin Dashboard “Settings” area that lets admins (1) upload/replace the website logo image and (2) edit all contact details, saving changes to the backend and reflecting updates across the public landing page and student dashboard without redeployment.

Update the public landing page and shared header branding to use the dynamically managed backend logo and backend-managed contact details, with sensible fallbacks if no custom logo/settings have been configured yet.
Remove all Caffeine branding from the UI, including the “Built with … caffeine.ai” footer link on the landing page.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create JK Tution Center website with user (student) dashboard and admin dashboard

Student profile system: students can create their own profile (required fields incl. photo; student phone optional), students can view but not edit; admin dashboard lists all profiles and admins can edit profiles

Update the backend user profile model to a full Student Profile with the following fields: name, age, class, school, batch (must be either "Batch 1" or "Batch 2"), tuition center, parent mobile number, date of birth, profile photo; also include student mobile number as an optional field.

Enforce student-profile permissions in the backend: only a signed-in Student (User role) can create their own student profile; Admins cannot create student profiles; Students can view their own profile but cannot edit it after creation; Admins can view all student profiles and can edit existing student profiles.

Add backend API endpoints needed for the Admin Dashboard "Students" panel to show all profiles and edit a selected profile, including returning each profile along with its associated principal identifier.

If changing the persisted shape of stored profiles requires an upgrade migration, add a conditional migration that preserves existing stored profile data (at least the existing name field) into the new Student Profile format.

Add an Admin Dashboard settings area to update the website logo (admin uploads; store in backend canister as bytes for instant updates without redeploy) and edit all contact details; changes should automatically reflect on the public site and student dashboard; remove Caffeine branding from the UI.

Add backend support for persistent site settings that admins can update at runtime, including (a) a website logo stored inside the backend canister as raw bytes and (b) editable contact details used by the public landing page and dashboards.
